derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as an adjective in the sense 'oblique'): from an Old French diminutive of baif 'open-mouthed', from baer 'to gape' (see bay)

means.word_mean: 1. two surfaces meeting at an angle different from 90 degrees
